total_revenue.context: Q4 revenue, down 24% YoY and up 1% sequentially, in line with pre-announcement.

segments.name: Gaming

revenue.context: Gaming segment revenue for Q4, down 45% YoY and down 46% sequentially.

key_points: Full year gaming revenue was $6.25 billion, up 13% YoY.
Decline driven by post-crypto GPU inventory, deteriorating macroeconomic conditions in China, and lower sales of high-end Turing GPUs.
Normalized desktop gaming revenue run rate is approximately $900 million per quarter.
Notebook gaming and gaming consoles averaged $500 million per quarter.
Normalized gaming business revenue run rate is approximately $1.4 billion per quarter.
Launched GeForce RTX 2060 at $349, delivering 60% performance improvement over GTX 1060.
Announced 40+ new Turing-based gaming laptops, more than double the previous year.

segments.name: Data Center

revenue.context: Data center segment revenue for Q4, up 12% YoY and down 14% sequentially.

key_points: Full year data center revenue was $2.93 billion, up 52% YoY.
Q4 sales decline was broad-based across verticals, markets, and geographies.
Hyperscale and cloud purchases declined sequentially and YoY.
Launched RAPIDS, a CUDA acceleration stack for data analytics and machine learning.
Google Cloud announced NVIDIA T4 Tensor Core GPUs availability in multiple regions.
Inference currently drives less than 10% of data center business but represents significant market opportunity.

segments.name: Pro Visualization

revenue.context: Pro Visualization segment revenue for Q4, up 15% YoY and down 4% sequentially.

key_points: Full year Pro Visualization revenue was $1.13 billion, up 21% YoY.
Growth driven by data science, AI, VR, and thin and light mobile workstations.
Announced Quadro RTX workstation with significant GPU upgrade in 10 years.

segments.name: Automotive

revenue.context: Automotive segment revenue for Q4, up 23% YoY and down 5% sequentially.

key_points: Full year automotive revenue was $641 million, up 15% YoY.
Announced DRIVE AutoPilot, the world's first commercially available level two plus self-driving car computer.
Mercedes-Benz selected NVIDIA for next-generation autonomous vehicle and cockpit computer.

shareholder_returns.context: Returned to shareholders in fiscal year 2019.

gaap_gross_margin.context: Expected GAAP gross margin for Q1.

non_gaap_gross_margin.context: Expected Non-GAAP gross margin for Q1.

gaap_operating_expenses.context: Expected GAAP operating expenses for Q1.

non_gaap_operating_expenses.context: Expected Non-GAAP operating expenses for Q1.

strategic_initiatives: Strengthened partnerships with Cisco, IBM, NetApp, and Pure Storage for pre-integrated systems.
Introduced RAPIDS for data analytics and machine learning.
Announced DRIVE AutoPilot for level two plus self-driving cars.
Launched GeForce RTX 2060 and 40+ Turing-based gaming laptops.

market_opportunities.opportunity: Inference market expansion and vertical industries like automotive, financial services, retail, healthcare, and consumer Internet services.
RTX ecosystem growth with new games adopting ray tracing and DLSS technology.
Mass market adoption of AI cockpit solutions and autonomous vehicle development.

introduction: Q4 revenue was $2.21 billion, down 24% from a year earlier, driven primarily by a 45% year-on-year decline in gaming.
Full year revenue was $11.72 billion, up 21% from the previous year.
gaming: Gaming revenue of $954 million was down 45% YoY and down 46% sequentially, weaker than our expectations heading into the quarter.
Full year gaming revenue was up 13% to $6.25 billion.

Three factors contributed to the Q4 gaming revenue decline: post-crypto GPU inventory, deteriorating macroeconomic conditions in China, and lower-than-expected sales of high-end GPUs using Turing architecture.
Normalized desktop gaming revenue run rate is approximately $900 million per quarter.
Notebook gaming and gaming consoles averaged $500 million per quarter.
Normalized gaming business revenue run rate is approximately $1.4 billion per quarter.
Launched GeForce RTX 2060 at $349, delivering 60% performance improvement over GTX 1060.
Announced 40+ new Turing-based gaming laptops, more than double the previous year.
data_center: Data Center revenue was $679 million, up 12% YoY and down 14% sequentially.
Full year data center revenue was $2.93 billion, up 52% YoY.
Q4 sales decline was broad-based across verticals, markets, and geographies.
Hyperscale and cloud purchases declined sequentially and YoY.
Launched RAPIDS, a CUDA acceleration stack for data analytics and machine learning.
Google Cloud announced NVIDIA T4 Tensor Core GPUs availability in multiple regions.
Inference currently drives less than 10% of data center business but represents significant market opportunity.
Expanded reach in enterprise by teaming up with major OEMs to introduce T4 enterprise and edge computing servers, optimized for NVIDIA CUDA-X AI acceleration libraries for AI and data analytics.

Launched NVIDIA EGX Intelligent Edge Computing Platform with over 100 technology partners, enabling AI computing at the enterprise edge for industries like transportation, manufacturing, industrial, retail, healthcare, and agricultural.

Made significant progress in data center rendering and graphics by unveiling a new RTX server configuration with 40 GPUs in an 8U space and up to 32 servers in a pod, optimized for rendering, remote workstations, and cloud gaming.
Early RTX server deployments at leading studios, including Disney and Pixar.
Announced pending acquisition of Mellanox for $6.9 billion to strengthen data center strategy, uniting two leading companies in high performance computing.

Post-acquisition, NVIDIA and Mellanox will optimize data center scale workloads across computing, networking, and storage stacks, enhancing performance, utilization, and reducing operating costs for customers.
pro_vis: Pro Visualization revenue reached $293 million, up 15% year-on-year and down 4% sequentially.
Full year revenue was $1.13 billion, up 21% YoY.
Growth driven by data science, AI, VR, and thin and light mobile workstations.
Announced Quadro RTX workstation with significant GPU upgrade in 10 years.
Key wins included Boeing, Google, LinkedIn, and Toyota for applications including AI and robotics.
Released over 40 design and creative applications with RTX technology, enhancing photorealistic rendering, augmented reality, and virtual reality.
RTX Ray tracing transforming the visual effects industry, enabling researchers and developers to take a leap in photorealistic rendering, augmented reality, and virtual reality.
automotive: Automotive revenue was $163 million, up 23% YoY and down 5% sequentially.
Full year automotive revenue was $641 million, up 15% YoY.
Growth driven by adoption of AI cockpit solutions and autonomous vehicle development deals.
Toyota selected NVIDIA's platform for self-driving vehicle development.
Public availability of Drive Constellation for virtual simulation.
Introduced NVIDIA Safety Force Field for autonomous vehicles.
Addressable market for autonomous vehicles estimated at $30 billion by 2025.
financials: Q4 GAAP gross margin was 54.7%, and non-GAAP gross margin was 56%, down sequentially and YoY due to $128 million charge from DRAM boards and other components associated with lower-than-expected Q4 revenue and current market conditions.
GAAP operating expenses were $913 million, and non-GAAP operating expenses were $755 million, up 25% and 24% YoY respectively.
GAAP EPS was $0.92, down 48% from a year earlier.
Full year GAAP EPS was $6.63, up 38% from the prior year.
Non-GAAP EPS was $0.80, down 53% from a year ago.
Full year Non-GAAP EPS was $6.64, up 35% from the prior year.
Returned $1.95 billion to shareholders in fiscal year 2019 through a combination of quarterly dividends and share repurchases.
Committed to returning $3 billion to shareholders through the end of fiscal 2020 in the form of dividends and buybacks, having repurchased $700 million during the fourth quarter fiscal 2019.
q1_outlook: For Q1 fiscal 2020, expect revenue to be $2.2 billion, plus or minus 2%.
GAAP gross margin expected to be 58.8% ±50 basis points.
Non-GAAP gross margin expected to be 59% ±50 basis points.
GAAP operating expenses expected to be approximately $930 million.
Non-GAAP operating expenses expected to be approximately $755 million.
GAAP and non-GAAP OI&E both expected to be income of approximately $20 million.
GAAP and non-GAAP tax rates expected to be 10% ±1%, excluding discrete items.
Capital expenditures expected to be approximately $150 million.
investor_relations: Posted an investor presentation summarizing Q4 results and key highlights.
Committed to returning $3 billion to shareholders through dividends and buybacks by the end of fiscal 2020.
Upcoming events: Morgan Stanley Technology, Media and Telecom Conference on February 26; RBC Future of Mobility Conference on June 6; and NASDAQ Investor Conference on June 13.
